page.title: 08FAMILY LIFE, THORALBY
page.content: Jane's family consumes large amounts of fruit. She likes to cook fresh foods and bakes her own bread; she believes in a healthy diet with lots of wholefoods and fresh ingredients. She thought of the advantages and disadvantages of living in the country. Two disadvantages are that all her children suffer from hayfever in summer, and there are fewer shops here. Jane is very happy living in the Dales and thinks it is a good area in which to bring up children: they see the cycle of life and death in nature and in people. Some advantages are that life feels more secure, and it is more peaceful than in towns. If she didn't live in the Dales, Jane said she would like to live in France or Northumbria.
